item.title: 贝恩资本与 SMBC 成立 15 亿欧元欧洲贷款平台
item.description: 私人市场公司贝恩资本（Bain Capital）和日本三井住友银行（Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp.【原文：Private market firm Bain Capital and Japan’s Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. are joining forces for a new European loan platform targeting corporate borrowers in Europe and UK.】

item.title: EQB 股价大涨，因为杂货店银行业务交易抵消了收益不佳的影响
item.description: 加拿大 EQB 公司同意收购该国最大连锁超市的银行业务组合后，其股价创下一年多来的最大涨幅。【原文：EQB Inc.’s stock rose the most in more than a year after the Canadian lender agreed to buy the banking portfolio of the country’s largest supermarket chain.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织认为阿根廷实现年底储备目标面临挑战
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）敦促哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）政府增加外汇储备，因为该组织承认阿根廷实现年底积累目标将是一项 "挑战"。【原文：The International Monetary Fund urged Javier Milei’s government to build up its foreign reserves as it acknowledged Argentina meeting its end-year accumulation target will be “challenging.”】

item.title: 巴西燃油计划打击引发分销商股价反弹
item.description: 对巴西能源行业有组织犯罪的全面打击，正在帮助该国的燃料分销商从非法经营者手中夺回业务，使其股价飙升。【原文：A sweeping crackdown on organized crime in Brazil’s energy sector is helping the country’s fuel distributors claw back business from illegal operators, sending their stock prices soaring.】

item.title: 尼日利亚制定雄心勃勃的计划，目标是到 2028 年实现近 8%的增长
item.description: 作为非洲最大的产油国，尼日利亚制定了雄心勃勃的三年增长目标，该目标在很大程度上依赖于非石油部门。【原文：Nigeria set an ambitious three-year growth target that leans heavily on the non-oil sector in Africa’s biggest oil-producing nation.】

item.title: 迈克尔-萨克斯（Michael Sacks）帮助资助反对芝加哥巨额工资税的广告
item.description: 一个由金融家迈克尔-萨克斯（Michael Sacks）支持的团体已经开始资助广告，反对芝加哥市恢复征收大企业工资税的计划，这引起了市长布兰登-约翰逊（Brandon Johnson）的愤怒。【原文：A group backed by financier Michael Sacks has started funding ads against Chicago’s plan to bring back a tax on large corporate payrolls, drawing the ire of Mayor Brandon Johnson.】

item.title: 私人信贷利润受到威胁
item.description: 2022 年，一代人中最糟糕的熊市让私人信贷公司崭露头角。今年的牛市让它们跌入低谷。【原文：The worst bear markets in a generation brought private credit firms to prominence in 2022. This year’s bull markets have laid them low.】

item.title: Polymarket 为与客户进行交易的内部团队进行招聘
item.description: Polymarket一直在为一个内部做市团队招募新员工，该团队可以在公司的交易所与客户对决，尽管其主要竞争对手的类似功能已受到批评。【原文：Polymarket has been recruiting new staff members for an internal market making team that could face off against customers on the company’s exchange, even though a similar feature has exposed its chief rival to criticism.】

item.title: 南非在金价创纪录上涨后开设罕见的新金矿
item.description: 南非 15 年来第一座新地下金矿周四开业，旨在利用金块破纪录的涨势。【原文：South Africa’s first new underground gold mine in 15 years opened on Thursday, aiming to capitalize on bullion’s record-breaking rally.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会调查 TP-Link 是否在中国分拆问题上误导美国消费者
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，美国联邦贸易委员会正在调查加州无线路由器制造商 TP-Link Systems Inc.【原文：The US Federal Trade Commission is examining whether TP-Link Systems Inc., a California-based wireless router maker, may have deceived consumers by allegedly concealing its connections to China since its restructuring last year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 碧桂园任命新联席主席以加强领导力
item.description: 碧桂园控股有限公司任命总裁莫斌为董事会联席主席，这家陷入困境的中国开发商在获得法院批准对其海外债务进行重组后，对领导层进行了重组。【原文：Country Garden Holdings Co. named President Mo Bin co-chairman of the board as the embattled Chinese developer restructures leadership after winning court approval for its offshore debt overhaul.】

item.title: 股市因强劲就业数据而持平，Meta 因预算削减而飙升
item.description: 由于强于预期的就业数据并未改变美联储下周降息的预期，美国股市周四小幅收涨。【原文：US stocks posted small gains on Thursday as stronger-than-expected jobs data didn’t shift expectations for a rate cut by the Federal Reserve next week.】

item.title: 康涅狄格州加入打击预测市场后起之秀的行列
item.description: 康涅狄格州消费者保护部向 Kalshi、Robinhood 和 Crypto.com 下达了停止令，指控这些平台在当地开展无证在线赌博活动。【原文：Connecticut’s Department of Consumer Protection issued cease-and-desist orders to Kalshi, Robinhood and Crypto.com, alleging that the platforms are conducting unlicensed online gambling there.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯将旗舰油价降至五年来最低点
item.description: 在全球石油市场持续出现过剩迹象的情况下，沙特阿拉伯将其主要原油等级销往亚洲的价格降至五年来的最低水平。【原文：Saudi Arabia cut the price of its main crude grade to Asia to the lowest level in five years, amid persistent signs of a surplus in global oil markets.】

item.title: 新申请失业救济人数意外下滑，国债下跌
item.description: 在美联储下周做出利率决定之前，美国劳动力市场健康状况的最后一次调查显示，申请失业救济人数降至2022年以来的最低水平，国债随之下跌。【原文：Treasuries fell after jobless claims dropped to their lowest level since 2022 in one of the last readings on the health of the US labor market before the Federal Reserve’s rate decision next week.】

item.title: Vanguard 计划在迈阿密扩张，挖掘更多拉美财富
item.description: 全球最大的资产管理公司之一先锋集团（Vanguard）计划将其迈阿密团队的规模扩大两倍，并在美国其他地区扩张，以满足拉丁美洲人希望将更多财富转移到海外的需求。【原文：Vanguard, one of the world’s biggest asset managers, plans to triple the size of its Miami team and expand elsewhere in the US to cater to Latin Americans looking to move more of their wealth offshore.】

item.title: 股价下跌后，飞利浦表示尚未发布 2026 年初的业绩指引
item.description: 荷兰皇家飞利浦公司（Royal Philips NV）首席执行官罗伊-雅各布斯（Roy Jakobs）在一次行业峰会上发表讲话后，这家荷兰医疗技术公司的股价随之下跌。【原文：Royal Philips NV said it hasn’t issued an early view of its 2026 outlook, after the Dutch medical technology firm’s shares dropped following comments Chief Executive Officer Roy Jakobs made during an industry summit.】

item.title: Meta 的扎克伯格计划大幅削减 Metaverse 的投入
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc.的马克-扎克伯格（Mark Zuckerberg）预计将大幅削减用于构建所谓的元宇宙（metaverse）的资源。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc.’s Mark Zuckerberg is expected to meaningfully cut resources for building the so-called metaverse, an effort that he once framed as the future of the company and the reason for changing its name from Facebook Inc.】

item.title: 加密货币从 2,000 亿美元的大跌中复苏，赌场人群继续前行
item.description: 加密货币中风险最高的代币正在崩溃，其规模即使以该行业自身的动荡标准来看也不遑多让，这些代币被散户投机者抛弃，他们承受着耻辱性的损失，而且越来越觉得游戏是被操纵的。【原文：Crypto’s riskiest tokens are crashing on a scale that stands out even by the industry’s own volatile standards, abandoned by retail speculators saddled with humiliating losses and a growing sense the game is rigged.】

item.title: 感恩节期间美国申请失业救济人数降至三年新低
item.description: 上周，美国失业救济金申请人数降至三年多来的最低点，这表明，尽管最近宣布了一波裁员潮，但雇主在很大程度上仍在留住工人。【原文：Applications for US unemployment benefits fell last week to the lowest in more than three years, indicating that employers are still largely holding onto workers despite a wave of recent layoff announcements.】

item.title: 乌克兰债务主管将在伦敦会见投资者，应对债券争端
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，乌克兰债务管理负责人将在伦敦与投资者会面，因为一群认股权证持有人表示，尚未就乌克兰主权国家的最新重组方案达成共识。【原文：Ukraine’s debt management chief is set to meet investors in London, according to people familiar with the matter, as a group of warrant holders said that consensus hasn’t yet been reached on the sovereign’s latest restructuring proposal.】

item.title: 富达（Fidelity）称新兴市场的最佳反弹尚未到来
item.description: 富达国际（Fidelity International）表示，如果 2025 年似乎是新兴市场强劲的一年，那就等着 2026 年吧。【原文：If 2025 seems like a strong year for emerging markets, just wait for 2026, Fidelity International says.】

item.title: 普林斯顿表示，灵活的电源可加快数据中心项目的进程
item.description: 一项新的研究表明，在热浪和其他紧急情况下，配备了自供电设备的大型数据中心比那些完全依赖传统公用事业连接的数据中心能更快地开始运行。【原文：Big data centers equipped to supply their own power during heatwaves and other emergencies can begin operations much more quickly than those reliant solely on traditional utility hookups, according to a new study.】

item.title: 尽管内部动荡不安，但 Two Sigma 仍启动新基金并筹集现金
item.description: Two Sigma Investments 正在启动新的对冲基金并吸引新的现金，许多客户并未因其亿万富翁创始人之间的长期争斗而受到影响。【原文：Two Sigma Investments is starting new hedge funds and drawing fresh cash, with many clients undeterred by the long-running feud between its billionaire founders.】

item.title: 人工智能先驱 LeCun 称 Meta 不会投资 "世界模式 "初创公司
item.description: 即将于今年年底离开 Meta Platforms 公司的人工智能先驱 Yann LeCun 表示，Meta 公司不会为他的新人工智能公司提供资金支持，并暗示该公司可能会设在巴黎。【原文：Yann LeCun, the artificial intelligence pioneer who is leaving Meta Platforms Inc. at the end of the year, said Meta will not financially back his new AI company and hinted it could be based in Paris.】

item.title: 美国裁员计划有所缓解，但仍为 2022 年以来最高的 11 月份
item.description: 根据职业介绍公司 Challenger, Gray & Christmas 的数据，上个月美国公司宣布的裁员人数在 10 月份激增后有所下降，但仍是三年来最高的 11 月份。【原文：Announced layoffs at US companies fell last month after surging in October, but were still the highest for any November in three years, according to data from outplacement firm Challenger, Gray & Christmas.】

item.title: 巴西经济增长下滑，为降息埋下伏笔
item.description: 巴西经济在第三季度失去了增长势头，这增强了人们对巴西央行将降低借贷成本的预期，因为经济活动降温有助于抑制顽固的通货膨胀。【原文：Brazil’s economy lost momentum in the third quarter, reinforcing expectations that the central bank will lower borrowing costs as cooling economic activity helps to rein in stubborn inflation.】

item.title: 津巴布韦金矿商警告提高特许权使用费将助长走私活动
item.description: 津巴布韦的小型黄金生产商表示，政府将采矿特许权使用费提高一倍的计划将阻碍投资，并刺激贵金属走私的增加。【原文：Zimbabwe’s small-scale gold producers said government plans to double a mining royalty will deter investment and spur an increase in smuggling of the precious metal.】

item.title: 欧洲从美国液化天然气激增中找到过冬慰藉
item.description: 贸易商们表示，尽管最初遇到了一些障碍，但本季度非洲大陆的燃料供应不会有问题。【原文：Traders say the continent’s fuel supplies will be fine this season, despite initial hurdles.】

item.title: 英国投资者在里夫斯预算案公布前从基金中撤资 30 亿英镑
item.description: 11 月份，英国投资者从股票市场撤资 30 亿英镑，在英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）发布预算案之前，几乎每天都有资金流出。【原文：UK-based investors pulled out £3 billion from equities in November, with outflows nearly every day ahead of Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’s budget, before starting to buy stocks again when the measures weren’t as bad as feared.】
